Reviews.Title: “Our first experience was an unfortunate one, which greatly detracted from the pleasure we should have had from our stay.”
Reviews.Author: JanetCOxford
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Do Pozzi for a weekâ€™s stay, and were shown to a pretty and comfortable room â€“ we unpacked, and settled in nicely. But then there was a telephone call from Reception: they had made a mistake, and allocated us the wrong room. We had to re-pack, move further down to the corridor, and unpack again. The new room was much less pleasant and quite pokey. There are few lovelier cities than Venice, and we thoroughly enjoyed our week â€“ and there were good things about the hotel (the room was kept beautifully clean, breakfasts were adequate, and the location was perfect). However, our unfortunate experience at the start of our stay coloured our visit at the Do Pozzi, and we would not choose to stay there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for heavy sleepers”
Reviews.Author: Tessa2011-9
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room, which was very small but unfortunately all the singles are above a really busy street, so one hears people talking; high heeled shoes and bags rolling along the pavement until about 11pm and then again from around 7am....moreover, unless one closes the door to the rooms carefully they slam and not all guests are very considerate. Some doubles are over the courtyard, and those would be much quieter. The bed was comfortable and the place was spotlessly clean. The hotel would have been great, as its location is fantastic; the staff are very obliging. The breakfasts are amazing: worthy of a much higher grade hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and cozy”
Reviews.Author: pbda
Reviews.Content: Tiny hotel tucked away in a rabbit warren of Venetian streets. Well-priced...just don't expect service. More of a B&B than a proper hotel. Worth pricing and if you don't mind a pretty small room, not a bad place to stay. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “a bit of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Pemburydramaqueen
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for luxery this isnt the place for you. On walking in to the entrance, you think wow this is really nice. Then you get to your room. very plain extremely hot! The walls looked like they could do with a paint you almost felt you were in a cell. The bathroom was a wet room totally impractical, and with the towel rail blarring out heat not a room to stay in. The hairdryer was a tiny nozzle on the wall, I think it would have taken me 3 days to get my hair dry!! The breakfast room was ok, quite small, but the breakfast itself was a good continetal buffet. The hotel is in a good place for everything but extremely dfficult to find, we ended up paying a local 2 euro to get us there. We had a room over looking the court yard but my mum had one over looking the street and she never got any sleep with the shouting and yelling from people going on all night and way in to the early hours of the morning so if you want a quiet hotel this isnt the one for you! A lick of paint up to date bedding and a few pictures and new fixtures and fittings would really help this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: lynne k
Reviews.Content: We went there last year. It was my partner's second stay and my first. We found the hotel clean and friendly and the breakfast was good for the price. Loved the courtyard and the central location. The room was a bit dated but clean and a good size. A good, honest, value for money hotel in a brilliant location and a bit more personal than some of the bigger places.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Do Pozzi Hotel Venice”
Reviews.Author: newfiegirl14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Do Pozzi Hotel during the last week in August to celebrate our Ruby Wedding Anniversary. We booked through Kirker Holidays and we couldn't have wished for better. The hotel was excellent-quiet, centrally located,and with its own private courtyard where we had breakfast and where later in the day we were able to chill out in peaceful surroundings. The breakfasts were very good-plenty of variety of fresh meats, cheeses, fruits, yoghurts etc. The staff were welcoming and very helpful. There was a huge bouquet in the room when we arrived,from Kirker holidays for our wedding anniversary. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel, and also Kirker holidays, and we would have no hesitation in using them again.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable and friendly. Ideal base for exploring Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Joanne W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Do Pozzi for three nights in August 2011. The hotel was clean and tidy, the room size was good for two people. The terrance outside was lovely partiularly to sit during breakfast or after a long day exploring and the staff were very friendly. This hotel is in the ideal location for exploring Venice. Be aware there is a tourist tax now charged per night during your stay, it is a small amount but worth remembering as our stay was part of a package we had presumed this would have been included in our total price however, this was not the case. If visiting Venice again i would stay at the Do Pozzi.

Reviews.Title: “very dirty room with noisy uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: kelly w
Reviews.Content: The room was very small for 2 people and the bed was very uncomfortable and noisy and I still feel the spiral on my back. The room was dirty and dried blood and dirth on the wall made it more disgusting. No safe in the room. The only amenity in the room was broken chair. I do not recommend this hotel . With this pirce I could get better room. you could not even compare it with Motel 2!

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: LeamSpa89
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at the Do Pozzi for 5 nights in July and we had a very enjoyable stay. the hotel's location is great in that its easy to get to by waterbus and only about 5 mins walk to San Marco square. It's also within walking distance to plenty of shops, bars and restautants. The hotel's staff were friendly and helpful, even organising a trip to Morano island for us. Our room was basic but very clean and comfortable the breakfast each morning was plentiful with lots of choice and it was in a lovely courtyard each morning, apart from one morning when it had rained heavily the night before! Overall i would recommend this hotel, although i would say bring your own hairdryer as the one in the room resembled an odd shaped hoover nozzle and wasn't very effective! Great hotel and we'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice....and the best location!”
Reviews.Author: MomeSanJuan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located 5 min from Plaza San Marcos and very close from a Vaporetto stop. The room was very comfortable and clean. We booked a quad room - traveling with two teenagers- and the layout of the room was perfect. One queen bed and 2 twins in a separate room. We loved the location, since we were able to reach all the attractions within minutes. The breakfast -self service- could be eaten in a lovely patio just in front of the hotel entrance. Very private, as the hotel is located at the end of a tiny street. The staff was very nice, we arrived very late and they helped us find a place to grab something to eat. They provided maps and guidance as you should know that Venice is a little confusing....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Solo Traveller”
Reviews.Author: Spandau8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideal for my 1 night stay in Venice. Situated only a short walk from St. Mark's Square it was an ideal base for my brief stay. The hotel is spotless clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. It has a lovely little courtyard where you can enjoy your breakfast/coffee. The only thing that goes against this hotel is the noise from the alley at night time which doesnt help if you have an early start. All in all I would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hope it's stillthe same next time.”
Reviews.Author: EGGs60
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Friendly and relaxed. Once when I came down to breakfast and the dining room was too full to accommodate me, they not only apologised (there was a table free within ten minutes) but when I returned to my room that night there was a bottle of wine for me as an apology.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for San Marco”
Reviews.Author: JDougl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very typical of Venetian hotels that arent Pallazze. It is small but quiant and it is perfect for the attractions of San Marco. Very easy to find from the Traggheto stop as well. We didnt eat at the restaurant but they do achieve a discount from the nearby Da Raffaelle for customers.

Reviews.Title: “Forget it”
Reviews.Author: peares
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine why this place gets three stars and so many good reviews. The staff was friendly, the bed was comfortable and the room fairly clean and it is in a good location. Fair enough. But that's it. Turn on the hot water in the shower and you get cool water turn, it on hotter and full power you get NOTHING. That's right a mostly dead hot water system in the shower. But it was a prebooked plan and we stayed. Poor breakfast included. Not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel 3 minutes walk from San Marco”
Reviews.Author: Chulendra
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days (2 nights) in Venice, and the location of the hotel was excellent as it was only 3 minutes walk from San Marco, 1 minute walk from the S.Moise' Gondola stop and about 15 minutes walk (avoiding the crowds) to the Rialto Market. Lots of shopping and restaurants near the hotel, though the shops near Rialto had more economical pricing. The hotel was small, quaint and blended in with the rest of Venice which was what we wanted (as opposed to a cosmopolitan sprawling hotel which you get in most cities, with very little character). The staff were very helpful, courteous and made our stay a very pleasant one. The courtyard is great to have breakfast in and since our room opened to the courtyard, had a very good night's sleep as well. We felt that the choice/range at breakfast could be better, but the food quality was great. The only other aspect was the size of the bathroom which was very small, and didnt allow for a long shower as their was no shower/bath cubicle and the water threatened (but didnt) to spill over into the room. All in all a very good hotel to explore Venice and to come back to after a day of sightseeing without actually loosing the atmosphere of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic central base, in a quiet courtyard behind Piazza di S Marco”
Reviews.Author: Mandyfab
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. It was very close to St Marks Square, so we used to pop back around lunctime to sit down, get some food and then go out again exploring. The self-serve breakfast was basic but satisfactory. We could sit out in the sunny courtyard and eat in the mornings. The room was comfortable and fairly basic, although the shower/wetroom was thoroughly modern and had been recently renovated. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would receommend to anyone visiting Venice on a budget, this was good value for money - we booked including flights through C'Italia.

Reviews.Title: “Good friendly hotel, very central”
Reviews.Author: sonzzell
Reviews.Content: We went on a four night break and booked the Hotel Do Pozzi, this was our second trip to venice the first was in a different hotel, we decided to take our children age 14 - 16 . when i booked it i was told that it would be no problem and we would all be able to sleep in one room. Unsure i went ahead and booked , and i am very glad i did. The Hotel Do Pozzi is a very sweet hotel down a small alley off one of the main shopping areas, approx 5 mins walk to St Marks Square , the staff on the front desk were very polite and helpful. We had room #47 which had two bedroom's , the main one had a double ( two singles together ) which is the case in most hotels in venice , the bed was fine i have slept in better but i have slept in worse. The second bedroom had two put you up beds in which the children slept which were very uncomfortable . The rooms were clean and the bathroom was spotless all which was cleaned daily. The breakfast is limited to two types of cereals a small selection of cold meats , yoghurt ,fresh rolls and cakes, but still very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: mia2001Glasgow
Reviews.Content: We had not done much travelling and really fancied Venice I looked around for a hotel for a while before i booked and then disaster !! our booking was changed the week before we left, i was terrified however no need to have been worried this hotel was great. It was easy to find as down the main drag and very near Harrys Bar and St marks square and also the water buses and lots off Gondolas. The staff could not have been more helpful nothing was too much bother the hotel was clean although pretty basic did have sky but our room only had two channels that were working not to worry not there for the TV. The brekky was ample it was continental but plenty of choise cold meats cheese crossiants cereal juices tea coffee. I would safely and happily say book here without any doubts

Reviews.Title: “A cosy home away from home”
Reviews.Author: SquintyMaginty
Reviews.Content: I travelled from London to Venice on the Orient Express in July this year and stayed 4 days in Venice at the Hotel Do Pozzi before returning to London. The hotel is conveniently located close to San Marco, amongst the high end designer shops. It was charming, I had a single room which was exceptionally clean and cool (the air conditioner worked well) - and nice to come back to on a hot July afternoon. The bed was comfortable, there was a desk, a chair and a wardrobe which is all one needed, it was simple but lovely and serene. Everything in the bathroom worked properly and it was well cleaned every day. There is no restaurant, but that did not pose a problem to me. A light continental style breakfast could be eaten either in the dining room or outside in the courtyard. Being on my own I felt very safe, and I was extremely happy there. I will alway go back and stay at the Hotel Do Pozzi.

Reviews.Title: “Good location BUT be careful.....”
Reviews.Author: umngmc
Reviews.Content: Not sure how this hotel deserved 3 stars, but for the inflated prices of Venice, I guess it would be considered good value. BUT be warned that right after we checked in and dropped our bags off in the room, we left to go sightseeing. When we came back, we noticed our bags had moved, and our coat closet door closed when we knew we had left it open. A zipper on my jacket wasn't full zipped up (and I always keep my zippers completely zipped) and a zipper pocket in my gf's backpack was opened when we know it was closed. It was fairly obvious that one of the hotel staff had quickly went through our belongings. Luckily, nothing was stolen and it looks like they quickly looked for cash/valuables and didn't thoroughly go through our stuff. But that left a bad impression of the hotel and dampened our spirits.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: EB0109
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel in an excellent location for arriving from the airport by waterbus and also for walking around Venice, it is close to St Mark's Square. The rooms are quite small but have everything you need. Breakfast was nice (the usual pastries, cold meats etc) and you can eat outside in the courtyard. The staff were very helpful with directions and suggestions on restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Tinks66
Reviews.Content: What a lovely place to stay in Venice! The hotel is in an ideal location for landing by waterbus and making your way around Venice. We arrived late at night and had offered to help a lovely older Scottish lady to find her Hotel, as she was travelling alone. We arrived at the Do Pozzi and asked for directions to her hotel. They took our bags and looked it up on the internet then gave us a map and instructions on how to get there. All of the staff were very friendly, helpful and polite. Breakfast was good and plentiful. Lovely courtyard to eat in and to have a late night drink. Mini bar prices very reasonable too! The room was clean and so was the bathroom. Towels were replaced daily. Beds were comfortable too. Air con was to a good standard and is necessary if travelling during June, July or August. One tip: two bottles of small beer and an even smaller single pizza cost 38 euro on St Marks square! Find places to eat further afield.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel near San Marco's Square”
Reviews.Author: joss7166
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful. Having breakfast in the courtyard was fantastic. The location couldnt have been any better so central to all the sights and waterbuses. Will definately be staying at this hotel in the future

Reviews.Title: “A random choice that turned out to be excellent”
Reviews.Author: OldiePlymouth_UK
Reviews.Content: We liked the look of this place from the Citalia brochure and it turned out to be an excellent choice - including 5 nights for 4 and an early-booking discount. Clean, friendly and very convenient for St Mark's Square and a waterbus landing on the Gand Canal. Our well-appointed if small room overlooked a delightful private courtyard where a wide-ranging choice of breakfast could be taken. Clean towels every day and at least one bed linen change in our 5-night stay made for a value-for-money base: not luxurious in the 5-star sense, but we don't look for that anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Central Venice, right by St Mark's square”
Reviews.Author: JGDN
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a short break with my husband and 3 daughters - 22, 20 and 17. We found the hotel easily from the square and were warmly welcomed by the friendly staff. Initially we were given a dark room on the first floor for us and another large light room for the girls. My husband went and asked for a lighter room for us, on the same floor as the girls, and they changed us with no problems at all. We ended up with room 79 and 80 on the 3rd floor, with lovely views over the rooves from our room. We were in room 80, which is actually above room 79, up some stairs, and so actually in the roof I suppose. It is a lovely large room and very light too. The bathrooms were nothing amazing, but they were both clean and perfectly useable. We had breakfast the next morning and there was a good choice of food, and you could eat as much as you liked . The staff were all friendly and helpful and we were able to leave our cases there during the day, after we had checked out, and collect them later. There is a pretty courtyard area outside, where can you can have breakfast when it is sunny, but our weather wasn't quite good enough for us to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: rita2801
Reviews.Content: just back from this little jem of a hotel.Great location just yards from St Marks Square .bedrooms are a little small but all facilities very clean.Towels changed every day and we were only staying 3 nights.Breakfast just the usual continental style but as much as you could eat.We missed a bar to come back to at night after a lot of waking around Venice.Top tip get a water taxi ,a bit more expensive than the vaparetto but what an experience.Great fun

Reviews.Title: “An excellent location, very clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: CornwallMole
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent position for seeing all the sites around St Marks Square. The staff are very helpful and the rooms were cleaned thoroughly every day, with fresh towels. Good air conditioning. Excellent buffet breakfast. No complaints at all about this lovely little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location...wonderful staff...great price!”
Reviews.Author: DrJonas
Reviews.Content: How can anyone complain about this place....for the price, location and staff ....it was wonderful! Anything closeby is at least double in price!

Reviews.Title: “We will always stay here when visiting Venice.”
Reviews.Author: GermanicusNewcastle
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my wife and I have stayed at the Do Pozzi. We first stayed as part of a Citalia tour in July 2001. We booked our most recent trip ourselves via the internet. We hoped to find the same charming and quintessentially Italian hotel we remembered from eight years previously. However one always is trepidacious as the second cup of tea never tastes as good as the first. We worried that our recollections had become sentimental and we were made to feel uneasy by the most recent review on this site entitled 'Never Again'. However it was perfect and far surpassed our expectations and it was the delightful place we remembered. We stayed in two rooms and both were immaculate. The Continental breakfast is varied and the buffet arrrangement meant that one could eat as much as they liked. From various breads, croissants, meats, cheeses, jams ,chocolate, cereals and fruit it was what I expected of a Continental breakfast in Italy. Those expecting a 'fry up' should perhaps go to Benidorm where they would not be disappointed!! Therefore I would say that the author of 'Never Again' was being disingenuous and their diatribe was due to petty vindictiveness. Owing to the claim that a member of staff had been rude to them. The location of the Do Pozzi is fantastic closer to the main attractions etc that we had recalled. The court yard is complete and lovely. In short we will always stay here when visiting Venice. Can't wait to visit again !

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: splinter9
Reviews.Content: Dirty, noisy. smallest bathroom we have ever been in... and one member of the staff was quite rude..... Breakfast limited. Very good location. That`s about it.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: ismobile7
Reviews.Content: I had a disappointing return stay at the Do Pozzi after a lovely stay in 2007. Unfortunately the hotel is under new management so the renovated annex where we were put in 2007 is no longer available. My room was small and had not been renovated, it was pretty dingy and the air conditioning was broken the first day. The hotel is a great location to the Vaporetto and San Marco with a charming courtyard and a good breakfast but overall I think it has gone downhill and for the price I could have probably stayed at a nicer place. Staff is friendly but not particularly well informed-- when I asked for a restaurant recommendation for pasta made by hand, he couldn't come up with one-- give me a break.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard great but you cannot sleep ina courtyard!”
Reviews.Author: Kurt_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and a great courtyard BUT my room faced the calle and since the aircinditioning was not working I was unable to close windows at night. The sound from the street was constant through the night. The pillows were the worst I have ever encountered and the bathroom was a joke. Although the location and courtyard are great, I do not think that my friend and I would ever stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing - not what you expect from a 'Citalia' booking”
Reviews.Author: EvansAboveWales
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2008 for 2 nights as part of our honeymoon. We were guided by Citalia's recommendation that this is a 'favourite' with Citalia guests, who enjoy 'taking breakfast in the pretty courtyard'. I cannot understand why it's a favourite as it is the worst European Hotel I have stayed in. The only thing this place has going for it is the location, (2 minutes' walk from St Mark's Square but nevertheless quiet). Otherise, it was awful. The room was very small, the furniture shabby, the carpet stained and smelly, the shower room (no bath) smelt of damp, and the view from our room was of a roof! The dining room (if you can call it that) comprised two interlinked, windowless rooms more akin to a run-down cafe. The breakfast was appalling - the worst I have ever experienced in a hotel - comprising just yoghurts, a limited range of cereals, tomatoes, pre-packed cream cheese and stale rolls. Our room key never worked properly, and we had to keep going back to reception to ask them to let us in, despite changing the key twice. After all the hustle, bustle and heat of Venice on a hot summer's day, you want to return to a pleasant hotel & room, and the Do Pozzi does not provide that. What made it worse, was the 'pretty courtyard' described in the Citalia brochure was in the process of major refurbishment and was unavailable, therefore you couldn't even escape the room to enjoy a coffee outside. One tip though for Venice in general - if, like us, you want to escape the throngs of people, head for the island of Murano. It is a miniature Venice - untouched, tranquil and beautiful. The only disappointing thing about Murano was the cafes and restaurants close mid-afternoon, so don't plan on having anrelaxing, evening meal on the island.

Reviews.Title: “hot rooms”
Reviews.Author: ozbill
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights late October. Room (26) was clean and well presented. A/C turned off due to winter? but rooms were very warm and mosquitoes swarmed if you opened a window. Breakfast is basic continental but nice if you get there early enough. Location is the great thing about this accomodation. We were lucky enough to stumble on it by accident while trying to decipher the directions. I'd go there again

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: The_World_08
Reviews.Content: You must stay here!!! This hotel is located in a great spot right in the heart of the best shopping in Venice. All the designer stores are at your doorstep, all the restaurants you could ever need are only a few steps away, gondola stations, water taxi stations etc are all so close. The hotel is down a little laneway off the main strip so it is dead quiet & the lane opens up into a great little courtyard used only by the guests for breakfast & for drinks in the afternoon!! Hotel was perfect, staff were great & very helpful, no matter what the question or request. San Marcos square is about a 2 minute walk from the hotel & rialto bridge about 10 minutes walk the other way. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone & everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: STB4JAB
Reviews.Content: Annual holiday for myself, hubby and father-in-law [an agile 86 year old]. Booked a private taxi for transfer to and from hotel which was a little dearer than other options available but well worth the expense - drop off point not far from hotel. Staff on arrival and during the whole of the stay were very helpful. Our room needed a little modernisation but single room for 'Dad' was ideal. Breakfast choice was good although have had more choice in other 3* hotels but still plenty of choice on a daily basis. Main sites to visit were easily accessible on foot or by using the water buses. We took a good trip round the Doges places called the secretive tour which we really enjoyed but felt the tour to Murano, Begamo and Lemoncello a bit of a let-down and made glass purchases within venice itself. We ate at Vino Vino, Tavernetta San Maurizio and the cafe at the Doge's Palace watching the gondolas and water transport go by [fantastic] and Osteria Da Carla 'Con Cucina'- all good.and would re-visit. We splashed out on the last night at Trattoria Da Fiore and whilst more expensive food lived up to expectations. We also went up the campanile to hear the bells strike and found the view as well as the bells exhilirating. This trip was 'Dad's' suggestion and he had a fantastic time, as well as the 2 of us. We didn't do a gondolo ride this time as this had been done on a previous holiday when we took a day trip to Venice, but the water taxi transfer from the airport was a very new experiance and whilst I amused the 2 men in our party when we hit the first crest wash and I bumped around and got splashed it was still a good way to start and end a throughly enjoyable holiday. If ever returning, would use the same hotel again, but would check if the room had been modernised first.

Reviews.Title: “Do Pozzi is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladytees
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Located just off St Marks. Room was furnished ina 60's style which fitted the hotel well. Excellent and modern bathroom though. The continental breakfast was very very good. Served in the little courtyard. The hotel staff were very friendly. Brill for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: Kov
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for Venice. Realistically most people wont spend much time in their room so what you need is a clean place to stay with a good location and breakfast and this place fulfills all those criteria. Its quite expensive, but so is Venice so thats hardly surprising. We found it nice and quiet, the staff helpful, the room clean and the breakfast fine. Its nothing sensational but the location is fantastic in terms of proximity to the main tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mariaquerida
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were planning our first trip to Venice very carefully. To be absolutely frank, I'm working in the travel trade, so now you can imagine how peculiar I usually am when the matter comes to the accommodation choice. We're a young couple without kids and on a pretty limited budget, and my primary goal was to fetch a nice 3* hotel at a reasonable rate near San Marco (it was our first time in Venice and we wanted to be close to the center :)). Well, Do Pozzi was the perfect choice for us! I booked a double room via the hotel site, it was very easy as the replies from the Reception were prompt and explicit. I also requested the confirmation paper for Shengen visa issue and got it immediately. The reception manager answered all my preliminary questions and our request for a non-smoking room was respected. The hotel is very close to St. Maria de Giglio vaporetto station, but to find it for the first time you'd better get a map and consult it. Actually, the hotel entrance is within a little patio and there's a sign of the hotel showing the direction. Once we found out where it is, we never lost it. When we arrived, there was some reparation ongoing on the facade. I asked whether these works are noisy and the receptionist explained very polietly, that it was their neighbouring hotel making some reconstruction and that the works last no more than up to 5 pm. That was true and neither noise nor anything else ever disturbed us. Our room #21 was facing a little street which was was rather crowded at daytime and in the evening. We did not mind it at all as we were spending almost all the time outdoors, but I assume that older travellers would prefer to have a room overlooking the patio. These ones are perfectly quiet. The hotel building was built somewhere in the XVII century and the room was very nice and clean. I loved the antique window shutters and Murano glass chandelier! The bathroom is small, but quite enough for two. Bath-caps, shower gel, body lotion and sewing kit are provided. There was also equipped mini-bar and TV in our room. Breakfast was served in the hotel restaurant as the weather was changeable and the reparation outside spoiled the view. The breakfast was basic, but OK. The staff of the hotel was extremely helpful and polite, I really loved their attention and positive attitude towards the guests. Do Pozzi is a great place to stay in the centre of Venice, pretty pricey for a 3* one - but in Venice everything is expencive!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Train36
Reviews.Content: On a fourth visit to Venice, Hotel do Pozzi was recommended as a quiet and charming small hotel, recently refurbished. We arrived to excuses by the Concierge that he had only recently received our request for two single rooms [we had booked Sept 2007]. One, a refurbished room was very small, dark and depressing, no mirror; the carpet clean except around the edges; clean bedlinen on single bed; bedside light did not work, flex on wall covered in plastic tape; bathroom tiny, hardly room to turn around, suitable only for small, slim people but clean and with decent towels. Second room was on the top floor which was 'being renovated'.; the room was grubby, marks on the walls where pictures had been removed; bathroom a hazzard. The hotel was noisy, on the main route to and from St Mark's Square; Breakfast consisted of some bread rolls, a few packets of cereal; an empty fruit bowl with a fly crawling in it and a carton of milk, an empty one of fruit juice and this was at 8 am! The Hotel staff were mostly pleasant but for a 3* Grading, this hotel was definitely not up to the mark and we only stayed the one night. Single rooms are at a premium in Venice and I have stayed in some small but charming rooms. This hotel I will definitely not go back to.

Reviews.Title: “stay in the annex”
Reviews.Author: adventurer44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel 9-10 through 9-12, 2007. It is extremely well located, close to the San Marco square (where we lucked into a concert by Emmi Marconne). We did not see any rooms in the main hotel and stayed in the hotel annex. The hotel has no sign or markings. You go down a narrow alley which opens out into a courtyard with tables where a nice breakfast is served (cereal, breads, juices- no eggs or meat). A door off of the courtyard leads to a small reception room. We hired a water taxi to take us to the hotel because we feared we would not be able to find the hotel on our own. The taxi called the hotel to let them know we were nearly there and a friendly hotel employee met us at the place where we disembarked from the boat and took us to our room. The annex is a short distance from the hotel, again down an unmarked alley. Room 204 had very high quality doors and windows. It was not large but plenty large and larger than most European rooms. It was very quiet and we heard no noise during our stay.The annex has recently been remodeled. The walls are fine Venician stucco, with a nice Venician chandelier. The furniture is very attractive French painted. The t.v. is flat screen but did not get any English channels. Typical of very old buildings that have been remodeled, there is no closet but there is a large amoire. Air conditioning cannot be controlled- it is just on or off. A/C was adequate but would not freeze you out. The bathroom is nice sized with marble covered walls. Fixtures are modern. Shower but no tub. We really enjoyed this room. We thought it nicer than a three star hotel would have. There is no elevator and this room is on the third floor. However, the hotel staff was eager to help us carry our bags up to our room. The view from the window is just an adjacent building. The hotel also owns a restaurant between the hotel and the annex. The food was not high priced but was very good. You get a 10% discount at the restaurant if you are staying at the hotel. One especially nice feature of this room was that there is a huge ice maker machine two feet from the door to this room. We could get all the ice we wanted whenever we wanted it. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Four star ammenities at 3* price”
Reviews.Author: Pussilina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Do Pozzi for one night on Aug.18. We got a room in the annex building, which from other reviews, seemed to be quite good. Well, it was WONDERFUL. Our room was a two-level loft suite on the third floor (no elevator though, but luggage was brought up and carried down by staff). Sparkling clean rooms and washroom. Ample cupboards, brand new furniture, tasteful decor and well thought lighting (given the fact that windows open to...other windows in minuscule inner court). Floors, stairs and chalet style ceiling are honey-brown wood and a wall curio cabinet displays Murano glass art. On the lower level there is the living room with big table, sofa, armoire and TV, and on the open concept second level the matrimonial bed. Air conditioning perfect. The buffet breakfast in the adorable inner patio did not go beyong pre-packed snacks but it was sufficient. Personnel helpful and polite. I strongly recommend this hotel not only for the ammenities but also for the unbeatable location. The surrounding restaurants are pricey, so, have a look at the menu displayed at door before entering.

Reviews.Title: “A good find!”
Reviews.Author: stokeysaint
Reviews.Content: Hotel do Pozzi is a good hotel, great value when we booked and with a great location. Situated only a few minutes walk from San Marco, it is an ideal base from which to explore the ciity and catch the tourist spots in the morning or late at night, when other tourists are not around! Our room was traditionally furnished - quite old fashioned but comfortable and pleasant. Breakfast was generous and served in a pretty courtyard at the front of the hotel. The staff will make you espresso or cappucino at breakfast if you ask for it. the only reason that we have given a 3 and not a 4 star rating is that our room had a stench of stale smoke which would dissappear when the air conditioning was turned on, but would be unpleasant upon returning to the room after a day's sight seeing. Perhaps be sure to reiterate that you want a non smoking room when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Cornishlaydee
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, this little hotel is very close to St mark's Sq and is in a smart area between designer shops like Bvlgari and chanel, there is also an excellent restaurant opposite in a little courtyard. On the downside, it is quite tired - our room was small, very basic had stains on the carpet and a tiny old bathroom that had a shower with no tray so the water went everywhere - the room was the size of a closet so the toilet roll,towels etc all got soaked, nasty plastic tray thing to stand on like at a swimming pool changing room. It was april and very hot but the hotel doesnt turn its air conditioning on until may-sept, which meant you had to open the window which lets a million mosquitos in - we got bitten all over so take some spray! Breakfast was just about adequate - packet cheeses and cereal. You could do so much better than this, I'd pay a bit more and get something nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but in need of decorating”
Reviews.Author: Member8
Reviews.Content: Stopped at the Do Pozzi Hotel in Venice for 2 nights in July 2007. Hotel is in a great location, just minutes from St Marks square but overall is in desparate need of redecoration. Rooms are clean enough but walls very scuffed, carpets worn etc. Shower room was tiny, almost like taking a shower in a small wardrobe! Breakfast was taken outdoors in their lovely courtyard, a lovely way to start the day. Highlight was the trip from the airport via a pre-booked water taxi, great way to arrive!

Reviews.Title: “Get the New Section”
Reviews.Author: texascouple21
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights starting on the 29th of June. When we checked in, they took our luggage and walked us outside, around the corner, and down an alley and up 3 flights of stairs (no elevator). But what a room!! Massive for Europe and large for the U.S.--chandelier in the room and in the bathroom!! Bath had a jacuzzi tub!! The location of the hotel proved ideal (but no view from the room). Very nice buffet breakfast in the outside courtyard of the main hotel. Pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and”
Reviews.Author: hbotis
Reviews.Content: I would advise any guests of non-European origin to be careful about staying here. My mother was staying here while I was in Venice at another apartment during the busy Venice Biennale days. Armed with bagfuls of shopping, my Australian friend and I arrived at the lobby where I rang my mother in my room. After several minutes staying at the lobby, we went up the room but was stopped by the counter attendant at the lobby. I asked him to call my mother in her room but all he was interested in was seeing my id. He did not even ask which guests I was looking for. A very rude staff who made no apologies at all during our argument. He was not even interested and accused us of not letting him know. This was after my friend sat down in the lobby while I made the call as he was busy engaged in other business. I have never encountered a hotel staff which is so rude and disinterested. Was he thinking we were about to stay at the tiny room without them knowing. Was he racist because I'm Chinese? Later on that evening, another manager did not even bother to enquire about the problem until we told him off again. It was afterwards that he made some half-[--] apology. Did they do anything about it? no. My Australian friend said the hotel attendent would not have acted like that if I were White. My friend also said the other staff knew what went on as soon as I called on one of them to take the shopping up to my mother's room. At the price they're charging, I've seen better hotel than this. Insulting & rude to say the least. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “How to beat the mosquitoes”
Reviews.Author: Greylag
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the end of May/beginning of June. My first impression of my room - a single - was that it was very basic and that the carpet was both shabby and marked but the place grew on me. The bathroom was fresh and the airconditioning was simple and efficient. Knowing mosquitoes are a problem in Venice I kept the shutters and window closed at night but nevertheless got bitten. I mentioned this on check-out and the concierge said I could have had a plug-in mosquito repellent if I had asked. So ask! I am sure the bedbugs mentioned in another review were actually mosquitoes. Breakfast is excellent and can be taken outside in the courtyard in good weather.

Reviews.Title: “One of our worst nights ever”
Reviews.Author: Tccron
Reviews.Content: I just had to write this, as I saw glowing reviews for the hotel as I was planning another trip to Italy this summer. Our family stayed at the Do Pozzi's sister hotel, the Pensione Accademia (which was wonderful!), and assumed that the Do Pozzi would have similar rooms and amenities. The location is terrific, you have to give it that. But the problem is that you are right on the pedestrian walkway to and from Piazza San Marco. So if you are on that side of the hotel you will, throughout the night (until at least 3 AM) hear the many groups of revelers passing nearby. When we were there the air conditioning wasn't really working (in room units that looked ancient) the rooms had threadbare carpeting and awful furninshings and beds. Having stayed in so many wonderful hotels in Italy, this was somewhere in the bottom two of three (out of about 70). Just thought you should know.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: fenice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Do Pozzi 21-24 March having looked at loads of reviews and then getting a recommendation from a friend. Initially tried to book via Thompsons as appeared cheaper but they had no rooms so booked direct via website. We had a very prompt email response and my request for a room overlooking the courtyard was honoured. We had room 26 which was very clean and comfortable. Staff were helpful and friendly and breakfast was plentiful. The position of the hotel is fantastic, near Gucci, Pucci etc as well as 3 mins from St Marks square. Also very handy for airport waterbus stop. My only concern is that everyone will see these reviews and when we want to go again it will be full!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: a&ssussex
Reviews.Content: this is a great cheap and cheerful option in a fantastic location minutes from st marks sq. staff were friendly, the rooms clean and cosy and the breakfast good enough to keep you going til lunchtime. you can walk through st marks square on your way back at night to see it lit up and looking fantastic (and no pidgeons!!) would certainly recommend this nice little hotel - for value and location it would be hard to beat .

Reviews.Title: “A comfy welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: s.a.m.England
Reviews.Content: Extremely clean and tidy room. A credit to the cleaning staff. Breakfast simple but ample. Reception helpful. We had a lovely stay in Venice, with a hotel that felt like home. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “So close to St. Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: BoomerTravel
Reviews.Content: After stepping off the train from Rome we got on the No.1 Vaporetti to stop San Mara Gigilo. Awesome views. At stop go down very narrow alley and head right to St Marks, hotel is on the right. Our room was in the annex section located in an alley way. Your card key lets you in the building and the room. No elevator. Room on second floor was good size, very clean, comfortable bed with windows and shutters to the alley. Small TV on a wall mount. Bathroom was also very clean, bright with a good shower stall with plenty of hot water. No room noise at all, just heard the siren in the morning when the square would slightly flood for a few hours. Breakfast buffet in the main hotel was good with a limited variety that ran low as the morning progressed. Can not beat the location to St Mark's. It take just minutes to be in the middle of the square. Nice to be close at the end of the day. To get the full flavor of all of Venice take the Vaporetti back to the Piazzale Roma bus station and walk the back alleys back to the hotel. Stroll pass Frari Church,Church of San Polo and the Rialto. So many canals, stores and cafes along the way. You just want to walk and eat its that much fun.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Clean & Convivial”
Reviews.Author: Monty103
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while travelling in Italy with my husband and friends and we found the hotel ideally situated in an interesting shopping precinct with a good range of trattorias and restaurants within close proximity. St Marks Piazza, Grand Canal & canal station were quite close by (less than 5 mins walk). The rooms were of a reasonable size & furnished with an interesting Venician style selection of furniture. The beds were clean &comfortable and the room serviced each morning. The staff were always friendly and helpful. One of the nicest aspects of staying at Hotel do Pozzi was the courtyard area which was a great haven for meeting and relaxing away from the maddening crowds of tourist encountered in August. Breakfast was also served in this lovely area. It was a real oasis to be able to relax in at the end of the day and enjoy a wine or 2 before exploring the local eateries. I had visited Venice on an earlier occasion and found this location at Hotel do Pozzi added a new dimension to my trip to Venice because it was so central and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good overall and great location”
Reviews.Author: BikerBird
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice on the last stop of our wedding and honeymoon trip and Do Pozzi was our least favourite hotel of the trip. To be fair though, the hotel we stayed in in Sorrento was amazing so no hotel was really going to match it! The downside was the room itself which was shabby and tired and in dire need of rennovation. Also, everyones door seemed to stick on opening and closing resulting in some door slamming up and down the corridor! But that's the negatives over with. It's a great location for St Mark's and the thousands of shops and restaurants. Water taxi, gondola and Vaporetto stops all very close by. The staff are friendly and helpful and our room was always cleaned with bed made whilst we were at breakfast (which itself was good).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Chucklers
Reviews.Content: Hotel gave good advice regarding the best way to get there via public water boat - responded quickly to emails. Very friendly on arrival, nothing was a problem. Room didn't have great air conditioning but really that would be the only snag. Breakfast was super each morning outside in the small garden. The location is soooo central - less than 5 mins walk to Piazza San Marco with a great selection of designer shops en route! While you are there take a gondola ride at night, know you are being ripped off, but enjoy a period of time you will never forget in your life. The city is amazing because there is no noise from cars! It is so peaceful at night but hiving during the day. Word of warning - don't be fooled into going to the restaurant attached to the hotel - the food is fine but expect to pay double the prices for similar/better restaurants within 150 yards (e.g Euro15 for a parma ham starter and likewise for a shrimp cocktail). All in all this is a stunning city - the water bus system is so efficient, use it to get around. The Grand Canal at night will not be forgotten! Would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Travels Places
Reviews.Content: We travelled around Italy by train for our honeymoon. From the train station this hotel is very easy to locate - you just take the proper water bus ($12.00 Euro for 24 hour pass) and get off at the San Maria Giglio stop and then it's a bit tricky to find but as soon as you orient yourself it's no problem. The location was fantastic - about a five minute walk from St. Marco's square and the walk is fantastic - the street that you walk along takes you by Prada, Valentino, Gucci to name but a few - really high end. We stayed in a newly renovated room that was in the same block as the hotel but closer to the water - the room was more of a four star than a three star room - it was very nice, very clean. The staff was super friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was in the courtyard patio of the hotel and very nice as well - good pastries and cappaccino's. For the great room and amazing location I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: znell
Reviews.Content: Great hotel Close to San Marco but in a side alley off a main street meant that it had a quiet location. Breakfasted outside in the courtyard. Great European breakfast that also included boiled eggs and great danishes. Was easy to find in the end - took the 82 water bus by mistake but it was close to the San Marco stop. Number 1 takes you to the door almost. They actually had a turn down service - shutters were closed, curtain drawn and bed turned down. One mistake I made was to have a 7.35am flight to Rome. It is very difficult to arrange water buses and buses to get to the airport on time so I took a water taxi. It was 90 euros for one person! Hotel was clean and staff were efficient and breakfast staff friendly. Great value

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised ..”
Reviews.Author: JPrin
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed reviews of the Hotel do Pozzi on Trip Advisor I was little anxious on leaving the UK but I really shouldn't have worried. We booked with Citalia, were met at Marco Polo by a very pleasant rep with excellent english who took us to the Water Taxi transfer stop. The taxi was waiting for us and took us straight away to the nearest jetty to the hotel. We emerged from an alley way into the main street that the hotel is situated on and I swear to god I stopped breathing. If you love designer shopping then you will love do Pozzi's location. More designers in one street than on Bond Street. Contrary to other posts descriptions of staff, all the duty managers were efficient to the point of almost being Swiss, housekeeping were lovely as were the waitresses who served breakfast in the morning. I can only say you reap what you sow. The rooms were small but clean and well equipped, the bathroom very modern and again clean, although the hairdryer was next to useless, no power in it at all. The airconditioning worked periodically, and we were bitten by mosquitos but that's being in a foreign city, on the water, in May. If you want a hermetically sealed vacation experience stay at a travel lodge in Basingstoke! Overall, do Pozzi is in a fantastic location, reasonably priced, the service was fine and I really couldn't find fault with either the hotel or Citalia. Travelling is all about taking a deep breath and diving in and the do Pozzi is ideal for taking in a huge gulp of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: swez1
Reviews.Content: You can not beat the location of this hotel. The staff were very helful and friendly and the breakfast served was decent. The room we stayed in was not really that of a three star hotel, but it was good enough and was clean. Overall above average but not spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Good value during Carnivale”
Reviews.Author: Donncha
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice without a booking during the Carnivale. It was Sunday, so not too busy. We found the hotel booking office at the Piazza Roma (under the car park) very efficent - found us this hotel, a bargain at â‚¬100 (double) for the great location. Very easy to reach by Vaparetto. Nice room, 1st floor (no. 21) looked out on street. No charm prizes for staff, but I expect that's Venice!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel do Pozzi
HotelInfo.Address: Corte do Pozzi | San Marco 2373, 30124 Venice, Italy
